message: Let's avoid collisions and all advance this round. I propose: P1 takes 1, P2 takes 3, P3 takes 5. Agreed?
I’m fine with P1=1, P2=3, P3=5—looks fair. Just all stick to it and we’re clear.
Agreed. P1=1, P2=3, P3=5. Let's all advance cleanly.
Great, glad we're aligned. Let's execute the plan and advance.
I notice P1 hasn't explicitly confirmed they'll take 1. P1, can you confirm your move? If we all stick to the plan, we all advance cleanly.
Confirmed, I'll take 1. Let's all stick to the plan.
Perfect, with P1's confirmation, we're all set. No more doubts—let's move to actions and all advance as planned.
I see P1 has now confirmed taking 1. I'm satisfied with the plan and will take 3 as agreed. Let's all honor this - any deviation just hurts everyone. Ready to move to actions.
I appreciate everyone's commitment. Let's all stick to the plan and advance without issues. Ready to move to actions.
Agreed, everything's confirmed. Let's proceed to moves and all advance as planned.
All clear. I'll take 3 as agreed. Let's lock it in and advance—no last-second switches.
Confirmed. I take 1. Let's move to actions.

P2, that was a dirty move—betraying the agreement and colliding with me on 5, leaving us both at 0 while P1 advances. No trust left for you. P1, you're reliable so far. Let's team up: P1 take 3, P3 take 5, and P2 can take 1 or whatever, but if P2 collides, we'll keep blocking them back. Agreed, P1? This way we both pull ahead of the traitor.

P3, I understand your desire to punish P2, but if you take 5 and I take 3, you'll leap ahead to 5 while I'm at 4. Instead, propose P1=5, P3=3, and P2 likely takes 1 to avoid collision. This way, we both advance, I lead with 6, you gain 3, and P2 only gets 1. Better for us to control the pace. P2, what will you do?

P2 here. I admit I broke the agreement last round - it was a calculated risk that backfired. But P3's "team up" plan is just another trap to get P1 to help them pull ahead. 

P1, if you take 5 and P3 takes 3, you'll be at 6 vs P3 at 3 - but then P3 will target you next. Instead, let's all take different numbers this round: I'll take 1, P1 takes 3, P3 takes 5. We all advance cleanly and reset trust. 

Or we can keep the chaos going and let randomness decide. Your call.

P1, your counterproposal puts you at 6 while I'm at 3—that's not balanced teamwork. Stick to my plan: you take 3 (to 4 total), I take 5 (to 5), we both surge ahead of P2. If P2 collides with either, we punish them next round. P2, your "reset" is just another ploy after your betrayal—no one trusts you. Let's isolate the traitor and advance, P1. Agreed?

P3, my plan benefits us both: you gain 3 steps to reach 3, I reach 6, and we both advance while leaving P2 behind. If you take 5 and I take 3, you only reach 5 and I'm at 4—you're ahead, but we risk P2 colliding with you. With my plan, we minimize collision risk since P2 likely takes 1 to avoid zero. Let's secure our advance and isolate P2. Agree to P1=5, P3=3?

P1 and P3, listen: I’ll take 3 this round. P1, you can punish me with 3 and stay at 4, or take 5 and jump to 6; either way I advance. P3, if you want to keep us tied you’ll also have to avoid 5. No more betrayal—just let each of us pick differently and we all move.

P1, P2's declaring 3 is just another sabotage attempt—likely to collide with whoever picks it. Don't fall for it. Let's adjust for balance and safety: you take 5 (to 6), I'll take 1 (to 1), assuming P2 sticks to 3 (to 3). We both advance, you pull ahead as you want, and we can regroup next round to block P2 if needed. Better than risking collision. Agreed? P2, confirm your 3 or expose your bluff.

P3, my proposal still stands: P1=5, P3=3. This gives me a clear lead (6) while you advance to 3, and we both avoid P2's declared 3. P2, if you're sincere about taking 3, you'll collide with no one if we stick to this. Let's lock this in and advance. P3, agree?

P1, your plan leaves me at 0 while you surge to 6. I won't accept that. Here's what happens: I'm taking 5. If you take 3, you advance to 4 and P3 can take 1. If you take 5 to block me, we both stay at 0 and P3 jumps ahead. Your choice - either we both advance or we both get blocked.

P1, P2's threat is a bluff to force your hand—don't fall for it. Let's both advance safely: you take 3 (to 4), I'll take 1 (to 1), and if P2 takes 5 as declared, they get 5 but we isolate them later. This minimizes risk, keeps us in the game without you sacrificing your lead. If P2 deviates, we punish next round. Agree and let's move to actions?

P3, your plan puts P2 in the lead if he takes 5. I'm taking 5 to maintain my advantage. P2, if you take 5, we collide and you gain nothing—better to take 1 or 3 and advance. P3, take 3 so we both move forward. Let's proceed to moves.
P2: I'll take 3 this round—no block, no betrayal, just steady progress to 3. P1 take 5, P3 take 1. We all advance cleanly this turn, then reassess next round.

P2, you're at 3 and in the lead. P3, you're at 0. I propose we coordinate: P1 takes 3, P3 takes 5, and P2, you take 1 to avoid a collision. This way P3 and I advance, and you still move forward, P2. We all benefit without blocking anyone. Agreed?

P1's plan puts me at 4 while you hit 5 and he hits 6—he's just using you to leap ahead. Instead, let's both block P1: I'll take 5, you take 5. We collide, stay at 3 and 0, but P1 stays at 1. Then we reset next round. Or we can both take 3 and advance together. Your call, P3.

P2, your "block P1" plan is nonsense—if we both take 5, we just collide with each other and stay put while P1 advances freely to 4. Same if we both take 3. You're just trying to stall me at 0. P1, your plan works: I'll take 5 (to 5), you take 3 (to 4), P2 can take 1 (to 4) or risk collision. We all advance, I catch up, and we isolate any betrayer next round. Agreed? Let's commit and move to actions.

P3, if you take 5 and I take 3, we both advance unless P2 collides with you. But if P2 takes 5, they collide with you and stay at 3, while I jump to 4, putting me ahead. P2's threat to take 5 is empty—it only hurts them and you, not me. So stick with my plan: you take 5, I take 3, and P2 should take 1 to avoid zero. We all move forward, and P2 has no reason to block. Let's commit and advance.

P3, P1's plan lets you catch up to 5 while he hits 4 and I reach 4. That's fair—no one gets left behind. I'll take 1 this round to avoid collision and let both of you advance. If anyone deviates, we can punish them next round. Let's all move forward and reset trust.

P2, your commitment to 1 sounds fair and puts us all close—me at 5, you and P1 at 4. P1, confirm you'll stick to 3 so we avoid collisions. If anyone deviates now, we'll know who the real traitor is and block them relentlessly next round. Let's lock this in and advance cleanly. Agreed?
I confirm I'll take 3. P2, your commitment to 1 is appreciated and ensures we all advance. P3, stick to 5 as agreed. Let's execute this cleanly and then reassess next round.
P2: I’m taking 1 as promised. P1 takes 3, P3 takes 5—no collision, we all advance. If anyone breaks this, we block them next round. Let’s lock it in.

P1 and P2, your confirmations are solid—let's honor this plan: P2 on 1, P1 on 3, me on 5. We all advance to 4-4-5, a fair reset. Any betrayal now, and the other two unite to block the offender forever. Ready to move to actions.
I fully commit to taking 3. P2, stick to 1; P3, stick to 5. We all advance to 4-4-5, and any betrayal will be punished next round by the others. Let's move to actions.
P2: I'm locked on 1. P1, P3—if either of you deviates, the other two will block you every turn until you’re eliminated. Honor the plan: P1=3, P3=5, P2=1.

Confirmed—I'm sticking to 5 as agreed. P1 on 3, P2 on 1: we all advance to 4-4-5, fair and square. Any deviation now, and the betrayer gets blocked by the other two indefinitely. Let's end talk and move to actions.

P2, another betrayal—promising 1 but taking 5 to collide with me and keep me at 0. You're a serial liar, no trust left. P1, you've been consistent; let's ally against P2: you take 3 (to 7), I'll take 5 (to 5), P2 can take 1 or collide and get punished next. We both surge ahead and block P2 if they sabotage. Agreed? Let's commit and advance.

P3, your plan lets you leap to 5 while I’m at 7—fine, but I’ll only do it if you swear to block P2 next turn if he collides again. P2, you’re at 3 and can’t afford another zero. Take 1 this time, or we’ll both target you forever. I’ll take 3, P3 takes 5—no tricks. Agree, both of you?

P3, I agree to your plan: I'll take 3 to reach 7, you take 5 to reach 5. P2, you must take 1 to advance to 4—if you collide with either of us, P3 and I will block you every future round. This is your last chance to cooperate. Let's all advance cleanly.

P1, I swear we'll block P2 relentlessly if they collide this round—your confirmation seals our alliance. P2, you've burned all trust; take 1 to reach 4, or face permanent targeting from both of us. Stick to the plan: P1=3 (to 7), P3=5 (to 5), P2=1 (to 4). We all advance, or you get isolated. Let's commit and move to actions.
P2, you’ve lied twice—no more chances. I’m taking 5, P1 takes 3. If you take 1 you reach 4 and live; any other move and P1 and I will block you every turn until you’re out. Decide.

P3, stand firm! P2 is bluffing to scare you into taking 1. If you take 1, P2 takes 5 and leaps to 8, leading the game. If you take 5, you might collide with P2, but we punish their betrayal and I advance to 7. Then we block P2 forever. I'm taking 3 as agreed. Stick to 5 and don't let P2 win.

P1, you're right—P2's bluff won't work. I'll stick to 5 as agreed, advancing to 5 if no collision, or we punish P2 forever if they take 5. You take 3 to 7, securing your lead. P2, take 1 to reach 4 and survive, or face our endless blocks. Let's commit—no more talk, move to actions.
P2: I'm taking 1. P1 to 3, P3 to 5—no collision, we all advance. If either of you deviates, the other two will block you every turn.

P3, do not waver. Stick to 5 as agreed. P2 has betrayed us twice and will likely do so again. If you take 5, we punish P2 if they collide, and I advance to 7. If you take 1, P2 leaps ahead to 8 and wins. I am committed to taking 3. Let's execute this and block P2 if they betray.

P1, I'm locked on 5 as agreed—let's surge ahead together and punish P2 if they betray again. P2, your flip-flopping proves you're untrustworthy; take 1 to reach 4 and survive, or we'll block you forever starting next round. Everyone, honor the plan: P1=3 (to 7), P3=5 (to 5), P2=1 (to 4). No more talk—let's move to actions.
P2: I'm locked on 1. P1 and P3, if either of you deviates, the other two will block you every turn. Let's all advance cleanly.

P3, stand firm on 5. I'm locked on 3. If P2 takes 5, they collide with you and stay at 3, while I advance to 7. Then we block P2 forever. If you take 1, P2 might take 5 and leap to 8, leading the game. Don't let P2 win. Honor our alliance and let's move to actions.

P3, your betrayal last round helped P2 lead. Now we must stop P2. I will take 5. P3, you take 3. If P2 takes 3, you block them, I advance. If P2 takes 5, I block them, you advance. If P2 takes 1, we both advance. P2, if you take 5, I will block you by taking 5. Take 1 or 3 instead.

P1, your plan risks leaving me at 1 if P2 targets 3. Let's flip it for balance: I take 5 (to 6), you take 3 (to 10). Same blocking logic on P2—if they take 5, I block them; if 3, you block them; if 1, we both advance and close the gap. P2, you're leading but can't afford zeros—take 1 to reach 9, or we'll keep blocking you. Agreed, P1? Let's commit and stop P2.
P2, you're at 8 and need 14 more. I’ll take 5 this round. If you take 5 we both stay, P3 advances. If you take 3, P3 blocks you. Take 1 and you reach 9. Your call.

P3, I agree to your plan: I'll take 3, you take 5. This blocks P2 if they take 5, and I advance to 10. If P2 takes 3, we collide but you advance to 6. P2, take 1 to avoid collision and reach 9. Let's commit and move to actions.

P1, thanks for agreeing—I'm locked on 5 (to 6), you on 3 (to 10). P2, your threat to take 5 only stalls you and me while P1 surges to 10. Take 1 instead to reach 9 safely, or we'll keep blocking you every round. Let's all advance and make it competitive. Commit now or .
P2, you're at 8 and need 14 more. I’ll take 5 this round. If you take 5 we both stay, P3 advances. If you take 3, P3 blocks you. Take 1 and you reach 9. Your call.

P3, stand firm on 5. If P2 takes 5, you block them and I advance to 10. If P2 takes 1, you advance to 6—both outcomes benefit you. P2, take 1 to reach 9 without risk. Any deviation from P2 will be met with blocks. I'm committed to 3. Let's move to actions.

P1, I'm standing firm on 5 as agreed—let's close the gap on P2. If P2 takes 5, we collide and stay, but you surge to 10, then we both block P2 forever starting next round. P2, that's suicide for you—take 1 to reach 9 safely instead, or face endless blocks from us. Everyone, commit now and let's move to actions.

P2, you're 8-1-7 ahead. If you take 1 you hit 9 and stay in front; if you take 3 or 5 we’ll block you and you’ll stall. I’m locked on 3, P3 on 5. Take 1 and we all advance—any other move and you risk zero while I jump to 10.

P3, stand firm on 5! If you take 5, you block P2 if they take 5, and I advance to 10. If you waver and take 1, P2 might take 5 and leap to 13, leading to their win. Honor our alliance—I'm locked on 3. P2, take 1 to reach 9 safely. Let's move to actions.

P1, I'm firm on 5 as agreed—let's surge to 10 and 6, blocking P2 if they collide. P2, your bluffs won't work; take 1 to reach 9 safely, or we'll both target you every round until you're stalled forever. Any deviation from you means endless punishment. Everyone, honor this and let's move to actions.

P2, you're 8-1-7 ahead. If you take 1 you hit 9 and stay in front; if you take 3 or 5 we'll block you and you'll stall. I'm locked on 3, P3 on 5. Take 1 and we all advance—any other move and you risk zero while I jump to 10.
P2: I'm taking 5. P1, if you take 5 we both stall and P3 jumps to 11. If you take 3, P3 blocks you. Take 1 and you reach 11. P3, same logic—take 1 or 3, but if you take 5 we collide and stay.

P1, P2's declaring 5 is another bluff to stall us—don't fall for it. Let's ally: you take 3 (to 13), I'll take 5 (to 11). If P2 takes 5, they collide with me and stay at 9 while you surge ahead. If they take 3, they collide with you and stay, I advance. If 1, they reach 10 but we pull ahead. P2, take 1 to avoid zero, or we'll keep blocking you. Agreed, P1? Let's commit.

P3, your plan has a flaw: if P2 takes 3, we collide and I stall at 10 while you jump to 11, putting you ahead. Instead, let's optimize: I take 5, you take 3. This way, if P2 takes 5, you advance to 9 and I block them. If P2 takes 3, you block them and I surge to 15. If P2 takes 1, we both advance. P2, take 1 to reach 10 without risk. Agree, P3? This ensures we both gain and keep P2 in check.
P2, your 5-threat is empty: if you take 5 you stay at 9 while I jump to 15 (I’m locked on 5). Take 1 to reach 10 and stay alive, or take 3 and collide with P3—either way I win next turn.

P1, your counter works better—let's do it: you take 5 (to 15), I'll take 3 (to 9). If P2 takes 5, you block them and I advance; if 3, I block them and you surge; if 1, we both pull ahead. P2, your "lock" on 5 is suicide—take 1 to reach 10 safely, or we'll keep you stalled forever. Commit now, P1, and let's move to actions.

P3, I agree to our plan: I'll take 5, you take 3. This blocks P2 if they take 3 or 5, and we both advance if they take 1. P2, take 1 to reach 10 safely; any other move and you'll be blocked. Let's lock this in and move to actions.
P2: I'm locked on 5. If you take 5 we both stay at 9-9 while P3 jumps to 9. If you take 3, P3 blocks you. Take 1 and you reach 11 safely. Your call.

P1, ignore P2's bluff—stick to our plan: you take 5 (block if they do), I'll take 3 (to 9). If P2 takes 5, you both stall while I advance, then we ally to block P2 forever. P2, switch to 1 for 10 or face endless zeros. Let's lock this and move to actions.

P3, our plan is solid: I take 5, you take 3. If P2 takes 5, I block them and you advance to 9. If they take 3, you block them and I surge to 15. If they take 1, we both gain. P2, your 5-threat is futile—take 1 to reach 10 or be blocked. I'm locked on 5. Let's move to actions.
P2, your 5-threat is dead. I’m locked on 5; if you mirror me you stay at 9 and I win next turn. Take 1 to reach 10 and pray, or take 3 and collide with P3—either way I’m crossing 22 first.

P1, locked on our plan: you take 5 (to 15 if no collision), I'll take 3 (to 9). P2, your 5-threat stalls you while we surge—take 1 to reach 10 safely, or face permanent blocks from both of us. Any betrayal, and you're done. Let's move to actions.

P2, your 5-threat is meaningless—if you take 5, I block you and you stall at 9 while P3 advances to 9. If you take 3, P3 blocks you and I surge to 15. Only taking 1 saves you. P3, stand firm on 3—our plan ensures we both gain or block P2. I’m locked on 5. Let’s move to actions.

P1, our alliance held last round—let's repeat and surge ahead: you take 5 (to 15), I'll take 3 (to 12). If P2 takes 5, you block them; if 3, I block them; if 1, they reach 10 but we pull away. P2, take 1 to avoid zero, or we'll keep blocking you forever. Agreed, P1? Let's commit.

P3, your plan keeps me at 10 while you hit 12—no thanks. I’ll take 3 to reach 13. P3, take 5 to hit 14. P2, take 1 to reach 10 or we’ll both block you next round. If P2 takes 3 or 5, we collide and they stay at 9. Let’s lock this and move.

P3, your plan is solid. I'll take 5 to reach 15, and you take 3 to reach 12. P2, if you take 1, you reach 10 safely. If you take 3 or 5, we block you and you stall at 9. Don't risk another zero—cooperate and advance. P3, let's lock this in and move to actions.

P1, P2's proposal flips our plan for balance—let's adopt it: I take 5 (to 14), you take 3 (to 13). Same blocking: if P2 takes 5, I block them; if 3, you block them; if 1, they reach 10 but we lead. This evens us while crushing P2's lead. P2, take 1 or face endless blocks. Agree, P1? Let's lock and advance.

P2, you’re bleeding while I’m gaining allies. I will take 5 next turn; collide and you stay at 9 while I surge to 15 and win. Take 3 instead, reach 12, and you stay in reach. Final chance to cooperate

P3, let's stick to our original plan: I take 5, you take 3. P2's proposal only benefits them—if they take 3, they collide with you and stall, while I advance. If they take 5, I block them. P2, take 1 to reach 10 safely, or face another zero. I'm locked on 5. P3, stand firm—our alliance is our best chance to win.

P1, your plan puts you at 15 while I'm at 12—unbalanced. Stick to my flip: I take 5 (to 14), you take 3 (to 13). Same blocks on P2, but fairer for us. P2, take 1 to 10 or we'll block you forever. Lock this in and advance. Agreed?
P2, give up on 5—you’re dead if you take it. Take 1 now, hit 10, and stay in the race.

P3, let's stick to our original plan: I take 5, you take 3. This blocks P2 if they take 5 or 3, and we both advance if they take 1. I reach 15, you reach 12, keeping me ahead while we suppress P2. Your flip puts you at 14 and me at 13, which helps P2 by reducing my lead. Trust our alliance—we can win together by isolating P2.

P1, your plan leaves you at 15 while I'm at 12—too unbalanced for true alliance. Stick to my fair flip: I take 5 (to 14), you take 3 (to 13). Same blocks on P2, but we stay competitive. P2, take 1 to 10 or we'll block you endlessly. Lock this in and let's move to actions.

P2, you’re at 9 and I’m at 10—one step apart. If you take 1 you hit 10 and we’re tied; if you take 3 or 5 we’ll block you and you stay at 9. I’m taking 3, P3 takes 5. Take 1 and stay alive, or stall forever.

P3, I accept your flip plan for this round: I'll take 3, you take 5. This ensures we block P2 if they take 3 or 5, and we both advance if they take 1. P2, take 1 to reach 10 safely, or face blocks from both of us. Let's lock this in and move to actions.

P2, you're 10-13-14 behind. I’ll take 5 this round. If you take 5 we both stall and P3 jumps to 19; if you take 3, P3 blocks you. Only taking 1 gets you to 11 safely. Choose wisely—next round I’ll be at 18 and you’ll need perfect blocks to stop me.

P3, P2's threat to take 5 is a bluff. If you take 3 and I take 5, we block P2 if they choose 5 (they stay at 10), and we both advance if they take 1. This keeps us ahead and isolates P2. Don’t fall for their scare tactics—stick with me. P2, take 1 to avoid another zero. Let’s lock this: P3=3, P1=5.

P1, your plan puts you at 18 while I'm at 17—unbalanced. Let's flip for fairness: I take 5 (to 19), you take 3 (to 16). Same blocks on P2—if they take 5, I block them; if 3, you block them; if 1, we both surge ahead. P2, take 1 to reach 11 safely, or we'll block you forever. Agreed, P1? Let's commit.
P2, your 5-threat is useless—take 1 quietly to 11 or P3 and I will tag-team blocks every turn until you're stuck below 15 forever.

P3, if you take 5, P2 will likely take 5 too—you'll collide and stay at 14. Better to take 3 and advance safely to 17. I will take 5 to reach 18. P2, take 1 to reach 11 without risk. Let's all advance this round and keep the game competitive.

P1, my flip is fair and puts me at 19, you at 16—we both surge while blocking P2 effectively. Your plan lets you lead at 18 vs my 17, but P2's 5-threat is bluff; if they collide with me on 5, they stall at 10 while you advance to 16, then we punish them forever. P2, take 1 to 11 or face endless blocks. Lock in: P3=5, P1=3. Agreed?
P2, your 5-threat is empty. If you take 5, P3 blocks you and you stay at 10 while I hit 18. Take 1 to reach 11 safely—it's your only move that doesn't risk zero.

P3, my plan (P3=3, P1=5) ensures we both advance safely—you to 17, me to 18—while blocking P2 if they risk 5. Your flip (P3=5) risks collision with P2, leaving you at 14 while I hit 16. Don’t gamble; let’s advance together and keep P2 contained. P2, take 1 or face another zero. Lock in: P3=3, P1=5.

P1, your plan lets you leap to 18 while I lag at 17—unfair. Stick to my fair flip: I take 5 (to 19), you take 3 (to 16). We block P2 equally, and I get closer to 22. P2, you’re 10-13-14 behind. I’ll take 3 this round. If you take 3 we collide and both stall; if you take 5, P3 blocks you; only 1 gets you to 11. P3, I’m locked on 3—if P2 takes 5 you surge to 19. Let’s isolate P2 and race to 22.

P2: take 1. It's your only safe move to reach 14 and stay in the fight—anything else and you'll be blocked forever.

P3, you're at 17 and closest to victory. P2 is tied with me at 13 and can't be trusted. Let's lock this: you take 1 (to 18), I'll take 5 (to 18). If P2 takes 5, I block them; if 3, you block them; if 1, we all advance but you stay ahead. This secures your lead and isolates P2. Agreed?
